quizlist.question: You are anchored in the Aleutian Island chain and receive word that a tsunami is expected to strike the islands in six hours. What is the safest action?
quizlist.option1: Get underway and be in deep, open-ocean water before the tsunami arrives.
quizlist.option2: Increase the scope of the anchor cable and drop the second anchor underfoot at short stay.
quizlist.option3: Get underway and be close inshore on the side of the island away from the tsunami.

quizlist.question: You are steaming in the open ocean of the North Pacific between the Aleutian Chain and Hawaii. A warning broadcast indicates that an earthquake has occurred in the Aleutians and has generated a tsunami that is predicted to hit Hawaii. What action is necessary for the ship's safety?
quizlist.option1: No special action as tsunamis are inconspicuous in the open ocean
quizlist.option2: Calculate the tsunami's ETA at your position and turn to a course that will head into the Tsunami.
quizlist.option3: Securely stow all loose gear, check deck lashings, and prepare for extreme rolls.
